list.content: First wheel ever! I own a few electric skateboards but I needed something more robust and that could easily take on on bumpy conditions. I received this 11-2-2020 and I'm writing this 11-6-2020. I have about 50 miles on it so far. I rode it to work 9 miles one way for the first time this morning no issues. Goes fast. I stay around the 15-20 mph range. Once I'm on I'm good to go. But I still need to work on mounting and dismointing. I am curious to see how it holds up in the rain. Time will tell. I would recommend it. I have pretty good balance so I felt confident that I could start on an intermediate wheel like this. But for some it may be too advanced to start on. Customer service was great and the rapid charger is crazy fast.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: This is my first wheel.  It was quite painful to ride at first because it's wide but after a few weeks the pain goes away (that's probably the case with any EUC). I have just a little over 200 miles on it now and it doesn't hurt at all.  The wheel is fast and responsive.  The only odd thing is it sometimes makes a weird noise at low speeds (the first few feet after you get on it).  I love this wheel and I take it everywhere!
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: This thing is an ungodly amount of fun.  Aside from the overly hard side cushions that everyone complains about, the acceleration and torque, combined with the agility of the wheel, make riding this thing feel completely unreal.
list.author: Patrick Chang

list.content: The best EUC I've purchased to date (3rd EUC) no preset travel distance to unlock top speed, Bluetooth speakers built in, 30+ mph, and a 45-50+mi range?! Im not even listing all the features either, nothing in this price range can compare.....you simply Can't beat that with a Bat.
list.author: Mark cole II

list.content: fast and quick. It good to have long rang miles and the fast speed.
list.author: Ger Thao

list.content: The Tesla is my first experience with a wheel. I've watched so many reviews of this wheel it's pretty much exactly what I anticipated. Im 60 years old and spent much of my adult life an avid mountain biker with the permanently marred up shins to prove it. After spent an hour with this wheel Im able to go 25 to 30 ft unaided. I was wondering if this might be too much wheel to start with but now Im thinking it was a good choice. my house has lobby hallways which are making a great way to train. I can tell already Im going to love this wheel it will be while outgrowing it if ever.
list.author: Roger Hooker

list.content: This is a fantastic wheel, great trolley handle great acceleration and top speed. The only down side to this is the case quality. Its tough but cant take a beating like a kingsong. The petals are a bit low too but just needs a few days to get used to.
list.author: Liam Du Egan

list.content: Absolutely an amazing machine I only had one real gripe with it and that was the side pads feel as hard as the case itself so I removed them and put a neoprene power pad design on instead.
list.author: Victor Hucker

list.content:
Thank you ewheels for the order! It was really well packaged and quickly delivered! It’s been 2 days with the wheel and I already love it! The gotway Tesla V2 is a real monster! Hard to get used as it’s my first wheel but after 2 hours training, I can already ride straight and enjoy short ride!

Excellent service, I highly recommend your website! I did a quick unboxing video if folks are interested: https://youtu.be/FJZ9tTN_qLg
list.author: Rodrigue Carneiro

list.content: This was by far the hardest PEV to learn, but also most rewarding once it "clicks". Nothing compares in speed and range in the same price point.
list.author: Anthony Jiehua Wu

list.content: I'll just first say that shipping was super fast.  I got the wheel the next day.  This is my first wheel.  Tough choice in this price category, but all great choices.  I'm almost 55 and I was able to get going with free mounting after about 1.5 hours.  At first, it seems impossible, but something clicked after a while.  My only teacher was Youtube.  The wheel is scratched up from the failed attempts.  So if this is your first wheel, get ready for that.  Don't forget all the protective gear.  Very important, whether you're experienced or not.
list.author: Wally Chan

list.content: My first wheel, so I can't really compare it with anything, but I absolutely love it. I have been riding the wheel around San Francisco and it has handled everything with ease, including bumpy roads and really steep hills. The range is awesome, and I'm happy with the speed even though I'm still limited to 24km/h. Ever since I first saw an EUC on the street it felt like the ultimate form of transport and the better I get on the wheel, the more I feel that way.
list.author: Percy Grunwald

list.content: If your looking for a wheel with great range and goes 30+ mph than this is the wheel for you. Even with my battery at 25% I was still able to hit 29 mph but cruising closer to 20. The only complaint I have are the speakers on the wheel but it’s a small sacrifice because the overall performance is A+.
list.author: David Castillo

list.content: I love it ! I’m happy with this purchase!
list.author: Edgar Garcia

list.content:
Man love this machine in D.C. this is great.
Clear traffic fast get to my destination on time an it only took me two days to get on it. Three to ride around my city. I hit twenty one real easy with this thing. Ordering new panels in two weeks to make it look new again but I love this little thing.
list.author: Thomas Conley

list.content: The Tesla v2 is a beauty and a beast. The ride is smooth, quiet, and stable. The carbon fiber looks great!
list.author: Thomas Le

list.content: Beginner EUC rider, glad I went with this model. It's heavy, and I was definitely discouraged with how long it's been taking to "get it." But the more I keep at it, the more fun I have. Acceleration and braking/stopping is smooth, turning is very easy, going over potholes and various uneven surfaces is doable. And it's a blast turning heads in the neighborhood with the music pumping - even if the speakers are less than great. Thanks Jason!
list.author: Michael Slamer

list.content:
I've ridden several wheels, and this is my favorite so far. Probably due to the fact that it's the newest iteration and they seem to have learned things, but still.

I like the momentary cutoff switch, appreciate that they put griptape stock on the pedals, as well as padding for your shins.

It's been very comfortable to ride for me and the battery seems to last long enough, so overall I'm happy.
list.author: Stephen Blank

list.content: There aren't enough words to express my gratitude for my new Gotway Tesla v2," a special thanks goes out to Jason and all the more than helpful staff at ewheels who with no hesitation or bs aided me in my quest to understand and choose this near perfect wheel . Chances are your on the fence about which wheel is best for you. Ultimately only you can decide.
list.author: Steve cobblestone

list.content: i got mine 5 days ago my first machine from zero experience and the best choice ever!. customer service is fast thank you jason!. it’s great doing business with ewheels!. i feel like im the first euc rider in my city i hope i  influence them lol!
list.author: Jerico Majima

list.content:
For my first wheel, woah!! Humbled me back down from cloud 9 on day 3 and was out for 3 days with a stubbed toe! 

What can i say, i don't regret a split second of impulse when finally settling on my first wheel and making the purchase. This wheel has plenty of power, which is great for beginners since it easily catches your weight. It's Definitely confidence inspiring!

Floating into my third month, and i absolutely love riding this wheel daily! The learning curve is steep, in total (including 3 days out from my early over confident crash) I was riding the bike trails by the end of my first week. Don't let the steep learning curve ruin the endless possibilities of exploration in a way you could never have accessed before!
list.author: Sergio De la Rosa

list.content: This wheel definitely has power and it never lets me down the cruising speed of 30mph is very comfortable.
list.author: Edgardo Gonzalez

list.content:
This is a performance oriented wheel, and it lives up to that. Overall, I’m happy with the purchase, but the ergonomics are lacking, and enough so that it will likely force you to adjust your riding stance to be wider. The only pad on it is placed near the top of the wheel, and it works against you, widening the wheel more in the perfectly wrong place. I’ve taken the pad off, my legs went through a couple of days of conditioning to get used to it, but now my experience and control has improved. 

It still feels boxy, and it still feels like I can’t get my feet in the exact place I want to, but I’m sure I’ll get used to it. Everything regarding speed, portability, responsiveness has been a dream. 

Last note, usually I prefer hardest setting on pedals, but I found the next setting down for the Tesla to be more compliant with hard braking and acceleration.
list.author: Denny Paul

list.content: This wheel is awesome.   Super smooth ride and very capable.   The speakers work well and the headlight is fairly bright as well.  It is a great starter wheel without breaking the bank or having to upgrade in 6 months.... though I am already getting the itch for a 3" wide wheel...   Would definitely recommend the Tesla.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: This is a killer machine, very stable, very fast and fun to ride. Been on a ninebot C+ last 3 years, no comparison between the two, speed and range are so much better on the got way, took a day or two to get comfy on the tesla because its wider and side pads hit different place on your inner calf so wider stance. I feel so much safer on this wheel, not quite as agile in tight places or real slow situations because much heavier and wider but I'll trade that for stable ride any day, the C+ was starting to make woo woo noise and warble about 10 mph so time to retire it, I'm positive I made the right choice on the tesla... I'm so confident and assured while I'm zipping along, it's nice to have the reserve speed and distance to enjoy your ride.... Gotway Tesla V2 is the bomb, thanks ewheel for your assistance in my upgrade decision  NO REGRETS ..... got a helmet and knee, elbow and wrist guards to realize the full potential of this machine....
list.author: Donald Brooks

list.content: What a beast of a wheel. Stability is off the chart and power is never ending not to mention the agility of this thing. Feeling of total control yet a monster under your feet. This has great value considering the price vs performance.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: Whoa boy, so let's start with the fact that buying this EUC as a 1st wheel is... a little nuts. It is powerful. I lacked enough respect originally, and it not so gently changed that. The wheel is beautiful. Absolutely powerful. Well built. Solid. When it says "2000w" it means it. I'm so glad I bought it, but it has taken patience to learn how to ride it. Probably I should have bought a 12" or 10" wheel to learn, but I wanted to buy one wheel and keep it forever. That's this one. No chance I grow out of it, it will go faster than I'd ever want to go. Only drawback is that it is so pretty that I cringe when it crashes. I don't want to scratch it up, but that's what learning is about. Highly recommended.
list.author: Mark Takata

list.content: I've been researching wheels for a while as a "last mile" commute option, and had narrowed things down to a couple wheels. Called Jason here at eWheels and after we spoke for a bit he actually recommended this wheel over the other two. It arrived fast and I immediately started working on learning how to ride it. This wheel is gorgeous. It is the "black carbon fiber" color and looks like a million bucks. Keep in mind, generally speaking, this is not a "beginner wheel" but I was able to ride down to the end of my street and back after about an hour of practice. The bluetooth actually worked well (I'd read some users had issues) and I have both the Gotway and a 3rd party app for it. The bluetooth speaker is just OK, but I didn't buy this wheel to play music. And as far as power/smoothness goes, this wheel is a beast.
list.author: Mark Takata

name: NEW: Gotway Tesla 16” 1020Wh/2000W Motor

shortDescription: Both the V10 & V10F back in stock, shipping now
BONUS: free protective cover & wrist-guards
This V10/F sets a new benchmark for the 16″ power class Electric Unicycle

list.content: Great wheel to learn on, after a month and a half, I have figured out the basics and am now trying to learn jumping curbs and such.  As other people have stated, I do wish the top end speed was a bit more, but I'm still happy with V10F.  No major falls yet and I have to keep reminding myself that if I do go down at more than 25 mph(if with safety gear), it's going to have to major consequences, so perhaps the limited speed isn't so bad after all.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: I chose the Inmotion V10 as my first EUC and could not be happier.  At this price point it has so many great qualities that most riders look for:  good range (you will get tired before the wheel does), quiet motor, comfortable tire, flawless motor cutoff switch, 25 mph top speed, can be used on/off road, adjustable pedal grade/stiffness, great lights and speaker. Great product and incredible service from eWheels - they are responsive and don't mess around with your time or money.
list.author: Augustus

list.content:
EVERYDAY I am looking for a window of time to ride, even just 15 mins.  With this Virus stuff and being a busy essential employee my free time is lacking.  Finally pulled the trigger on my V10.  First Time rider and I did my homework before dropping $ on this venture.  For other first timers this is a great comfortable and strong wheel.  Being 230 lbs and 35 yrs old my anxiety toward my ability to ride was building.  With all the tutorial videos on youtube and tips from others, within a week I was mildy rolling without a wall next to me.  Within my 21 day goal, my body had learned the new skills to handle the wheel and everything clicked into place.  I love zipping around and weaving to the music.  Headlight is Super Bright, there is no reason a car wouldn't see you riding at night.  Speakers are nice and clear, Loud too!  Got 60 miles on her now and looking forward to every additional mile.
Dealing with EWheels was great.  Wheel was shipped out the afternoon I ordered it & From CA - VA I had the wheel Friday in time for the weekend.  I still have more to learn and build my skills, but this is the perfect wheel for me, no complaints here.
list.author: Wheatley

list.content:
I'm 6'-3", 235lbs.
I love this wheel for quick trips to store or cruising around neighborhood because it's super nibble, very comfortable on rough surfaces and it's easy to trolley and still light for the occasional carrying. Internal and external Build quality is impressive!! With my weight and a average speed of 18mph, top speed of 22mph, EUC world app displayed 14 miles traveled and battery was at 26%
It handles great off-road. Again the ride is nice with that tire on it! The tilt back is subtle, not scary but let's you know to slow down. Speaker is decent when not in motion but I can't hear it when I'm riding even with no helmet on.
I'm not really a dancing lights kinda guy but they are nice, I like that you can customize the color and motion pattern of the lights.

As far as my dealings with ewheels, I've purchased 4 wheels from them and I will continue to purchase from them, they are TRUE PROFESSIONALS WHO CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS!!!!! If I truly tried to expressed how impressed I am with ewheels you guys would think I'm getting paid for this review haha which isn't the case.
list.author: Marius

list.content: Can't stop smiling.....having so much fun on my new V10. I'm 52 years old, never used a EUC before. It took me a few tries to ride, thankfully I got the Inmotion cover with it (Thanks ewheels). I went for a 3 mile ride today....once you get it, Wow it becomes fun. Product seems well built and zero issues with shipping during the Covid 19 pandemic. Would recommend to anyone thinking about this technology,  it is awesome.
list.author: Rob

list.content: This v10 ride's awesome like said it has the updated foot rest my wheel was shipped fast and i can not wait till my next wheel gets shipped thank you ewheels
list.author: Jason

list.content: Love my V10F! Smooth ride, quiet, and great range on battery.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: I bought the v10 starting the Covid-19 pandemic so I could not ride it until recently that the lockdown has lessend in Medellín, Colombia. Must say that the wheel is amazing, well built, sturdy and up to now very realiable. Also the companion app will keep you engaged with all the stats it provides and as a way to interact with other riders around the world. I got the V10 with 650 Wh and it seems to be just enough for me. I love the big and wide tire, without being overkill. Very parctical wheel indeed. The range is enough for me, usually my feet get tired before the battery gets to 20% charge, although the pedals are big and comfy. Jason was really helpful and helped me find a cheaper alternative to ship the wheel to my country. I also got the rapid charger, which is a real gem as it not only preserves the battery (80%, 90%, 100% charge), but charges also at 1/3 of the time at 5 amps (also configurable). All in all, highly recommeded seller and wheel. Thanks Jason!
list.author: Jose Juan Echeverri

list.content: I had the Inmotion V8 for about a year and upgraded to my new V10. And Its amazing. It's heavier and faster and much more comfortable. It's not as torque-y as the V8, slower on the acceleration but once it gives, it keeps giving. One thing to note is the Pedals and not rubber as advertised but instead sandpaper like the V8, a much appreciated upgrade.
list.author: Riaz Uddin

list.content: I just received my V10.  I am still learning how to ride and having alot of fun.  One thing I noticed is that it now comes with a hybrid sanpaper/cushioned pedal even though this description say just silicone/rubber.  I just though that people should know this improvements.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: Love this V10F first time rider learning on this was a pleasure took a lot of beatings after two hours finally got the hang of it and boy that’s when you realize you’re riding a Royals Royce very comfortable very nimble and love the Bluetooth speakers put it on loud so Cars can hear me love the light Effects on the side of the V10. No problem with the handle works like a charm only gripe is the foot pedals they are a bit slippery so I ordered their upgrade with the grip tape instead of the rubber rubber slips a lot.
list.author: Robert recco

list.content: Having ridden the Glide 3 for 8 months as a daily commuter, I am particularly stricken by what a perfect hop-up the V10F is from the V8/Glide 3. The extra tire width strengthens its grip on the pavement, the over-engineered 2000w motor limited to 25mph gives me the confidence at higher speeds and in hard acceleration / stops I was looking for without fretting over a possible fried control board. I expected to dislike the external handle as a result of other reviewers referring to it feeling cheap, though I honestly don’t feel the telescoping handle feels much better... there’s an equal amount of play room in both versions, IMO. Extended battery life and improved LEDs are just icing on the cake. Looking forward to packing on some mileage!
list.author: Brandon Peters

list.content: It’s a fantastic middle-grounder — fast and powerful, but not too much so. Substantial, but not too heavy. Equally capable on-road or off. Love it.
list.author: Joshua Tabin

list.content: beautiful wheel
list.author: Edgardo Gonzalez

list.content: I purchased the V10 (frome ewheels.com) about 8 months ago and learned to ride it over a period of days in 15 minute sessions.  I'm 53 and have done many outdoor sports and this experience is the most freeing (though riding, strictly speaking, isn't a sport).  I agree with other purchasers.  The wheel is reliable, well designed physically and from the control system perspective.  I especially like the leg pad design.  If the foot paddles are wet, it gets slippery, but generally, they work very well.  The only improvements I could recommend would be in the InMotion app, but that is irrelevant to the experience of riding.
list.author: James Moore

list.content: What an INCREDIBLY smooth ride this thing gives.  I am brand new to eWheels in general, but it took just a half hour to get the basics down; I chalk that up to a pretty darn good dynamics algorithm.  Acceleration is gentle, nullifies instabilities very well, and on low battery it still hums along just fine.  I weigh a bit more than average, and I'm getting around 44 miles of range out of this (including heavy starts and stops, gentle hills and some unpaved roads).  The quality of this thing is amazing.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content:
I love the my  InMotion V10F,  I love the overengineered power of the 2000 watt motor and have faith that this will will last much longer than comparable wheels because of the overengineering.   The range is nowhere near 62 miles.  I live in Seattle and weigh 200 lbs and plan to use 25 miles as my range estimate based on my research from other V10F owners until my experience teaches me that I can go further.     This includes not draining the battery below 20% because I know that is bad for the battery.   I rode my V10F up a 4 block long steep hill and it accelerated while going up with no problems.   If you are going to do long hill climbs with 3000  feet of vertical this wheel can struggle as I have seen in a couple YouTube videos but bear in mind that the v10F is being torchered in these videos and other wheels have their failures to.   I am confident that my V10f can climb the nasty hills we have around Seattle but that if I want to climb a mountain that there are better EUCs for that.

This wheel weighs 46 lbs.   When you pick it up, it's heavy.   The V10F was engineered with protections to help not fry the board.   With the 2000 watt motor it could easily go 30 to 35 mph.   I don't want to become one with the pavement at 35 mph and and am glad the wheel will save me from myself by limiting me to 25 mph.   A downside is that when I come off the wheel while learning to ride it skittered away before turning itself off.   This is something that other wheels are better at.   Other EUCs are know for better braking than the V10F,  I have found the brakes to be fine for me.   

I love the big foot plates.   Some reviewers have talked about slipping off but I stick like glue.  Shifting my feet while riding is hard for me because I stick so well, even when my feet are wet.   Your mileage may very.   There is a grip tape conversion kit on eBay that (at this time) I do not plan to buy.    

Safety:  
Wear elbow, wrist, knee guards and a helmet  ...  Hindsight is 20/20, better safe than sorry.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: This is my first wheel. I learned how to ride it in about an hour. I haven't been off of it for the last three days! I don't know how it compares to other wheels but the fit and finish is great and it rides like the wind. I've ridden it straight for 38 miles and still had juice left.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: I’ve owned the v10F since launch and have since put 2k miles on it. I’ve owned three other EUC’s prior and find this wheel to be extremely comfortable on the shins and the extra long foot plates reduce fatigue on my feet. The extra width of the tire provides great stability and shock absorbtion and I find it a terrific hill climber . I would highly recommend this wheel to anyone .
list.author: Andrew Flicker

list.content: WoW! What an experience. 3 month later I love my new transportation to work. I am 6'2'' 240lbs at 43 years of age. This wheel as a new rider gets me 11 miles to work and 10 miles home with 9% battery left on one charge going 19-22mph to and 15-10mph from work. The V10F is very comfortable smooth and fun. i ride mostly on bike paths with some onroad asphalt, sidewalks as well as some off raod dirt/mud situations. I always want to go faster and hit the limiter(mild tiltback/audible beeps) as the wheel keeps me at a safer speed. If I push the wheel too hard with excessive acceleration or low battery/large power draw at once the wheel will do a slow tiltback with beeps or audible "get off" so I can exit the wheel, turn off the unit and restart again which is better than just a full power cut-off/faceplant. The headlight is bright at night and has a big coverage range. The speakers for music/calls/alert tones are loud and surprisingly have a full range of sound and volume. I have crashed mine 2 times at full speed as well as numerous slow maneuvers and the shell is extremely durable. The app to bluetooth to the wheel takes a few tries to connect but works perfecrtly with live readings, trip tracking as well as on the fly advanced adjustments like peddle angles, lighting featurs, horn, volumes, ride control etc. It took me alot of trial and error to learn all the manual controls, safety features and options this wheel has to offer.  3 months/500miles later with no problems and nothing but good times.
list.author: Arlon Burns

list.content:
I purchased the Inmotion V10F as something of an upgrade from the Kingsong 16S.  In that regard, the V10F has exceeded my expectations.  I was looking for something a bit more "stable" with a smoother, more comfortable ride... with those expectations in mind, the V10F was a perfect fit!  The wider tire REALLY gives a smooth ride over what would otherwise be rough terrain for the 16S.  The larger rubber padded pedals make for an extremely comfortable ride, no more foot fatigue or pain, and their height means better clearance off-road and all but eliminates pedal scrape in urban areas.

Of course, nothing comes without a price.  You do give up some of the incredible responsiveness and otherwise incredible nimbleness of the 16S.  Not too much, in my opinion... the V10F has decent acceleration and maneuverability, but there is no denying a measurable trade-off.

That said, right now, the V10F has the ride characteristics that I desire more.
list.author: Robert Lynch

list.content:
Fabulous wheel!

I put 100 miles on this wheel last weekend and overall I am VERY impressed by what Inmotion has created.  I have over 500 miles on the Inmotion V8 / Solowheel Glide 3 and this V10  is a worthy upgrade for a commuter like myself.  

This wheel is ideal for people who plan on commuting or taking regular long trips.  It feels like an SUV.  Big, comfortable, powerful, etc.   This is what you want to take on a road trip.

If you are looking for a big comfortable, SAFE wheel.  Look no further! They did an awesome job with this one!

LOVE:
1.  Huge 2000W motor
2.  Huge Battery (range!)
3.  Overengineered and even redundant safety 
4.  Bright headlight
5.  Surprisingly a really good speaker
6.  Big tire for comfort and cruise
7.  25 mph top speed! (over the 18.5 of the inmotion V8.)

Bothers me:
1.  Handle is wobbly and seems cheap
2.  That's about it.  This thing is great!
list.author: Preston

name: Inmotion V10/V10F, 960Wh Battery/2000W Motor
relatedProductsNames: NEW: Gotway MCM5 14”. ‘The Mountain Climber’. 800Wh Battery/1500W Motor

shortDescription: Temporarily out of stock, next supply expected 2nd week of August
Compatible with the Inmotion V8/Glide 3, V5F, & Glide 2
This listing is for a set of pedals, with spacer, screws & support rod
Existing eWheel Customers will be credited back the shipping costs within the continental USA

list.content: I have pretty much no experience with EUCs, but I feel much more in control with these larger pedals. Did not get the needed spacers with the shipment,  but it was not a big deal, since I own a lathe and had some made in 10 min.
list.author: Gottfried Schiller

list.content: Lots better than stock
list.author: charles green

list.content: Perfect for the V8.
list.author: Harold Kirkpatirck

list.content: Night and day difference once I swapped these out and got rid of the stock pedals. I’m still learning how to ride and the larger pedals help. I took away a star because the pedals no longer stay up.
list.author: James P. Baynes

list.content:
Great pedals. Some weirdness with the included 3D printed washers. Otherwise fine.

I would totally recommend getting these, they give you more control, the wheel feels more responsive.

I have the V8, I never understood why inmotion put that stupid rubber thing on the pedal that sticks up into your feet.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content:
These really improve the V8/Glide 3.  They make accelleration and braking easier and more responsive due to increased leverage, reduce foot pain and fatigue allowing longer more comfortable rides, and they provide noticeable cushioning from bumps thanks to the internal honeycomb design that provides more cushion than the their appearance would lead you to believe. 
Only downside I have noticed is I have had a few light scrapes while turning sharply, which never happened to me before with the smaller stock pedals.
list.author: Steve G

list.content: Much more comfortable than the stock pedals. Love em.
list.author: Joel Wheat

list.content: This is a follow-up review to my previous post.  The V10 pedals are a must for any v8/Glide 3 owners.  The V8/Glide 3 is not only more comfortable to ride both short and long distances, but it is also much easier to control.  The installation is pretty straight forward, however, since the 3D printed spacers did not come with the pedals, I did have to use nylon washers and with a little sanding to fit.  You can also use nylon spacers which are also available. Other than that these are the best investment you can make for both comfort and rideability.
list.author: FRANKLIN WEST

list.content:
Installation couldn't have been any easier. Maybe 20 minutes to install both of them. These even fit my V5F. You'll notice the difference in riding the first moment you mount up. Felt like I could ride all day.
The only issues is with the additional 3D printed washer -- it wasn't he right size for the shaft that was provided. Don't try to force it -- this will just crack the washer (mine did). Instead, you'll need to widen the inner diameter, either with a knife or a drill, to get the shaft to fit through it.
list.author: Randy Wentworth

list.content: The pedals give a better ride experience. Installation instructions would be nice, assembly is fairly obvious, but continued insertion of the end screws to provide pedal drop stiffness is not. The quality of parts is good with the exception of the spacers, they are awful, so bad I threw them out and made my own. Advice re the rubber top would be nice. Some owners have replaced with a grip-tape mod available from the UK. Would appreciate advice from the industry on why rubber was used, is it safe in the wet?
list.author: Norman Canham

list.content: Installation is very simple.  The trick is to use the old washers along with one of the supplied washers.  The pre-locked screws worked beautifully after they get properly tightened.  The pedals felt like day and night...what a difference! Like gliding on a cloud. Zero ankle fatigue;  very smooth.  Get these pedals! Don’t miss out.  You’ll ride your wheel longer and more comfortable.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content:
The new pedals are nice, big and comfortable. I’m glad it came in black and matched perfectly with the wheel. While it’s much bigger then the original ones, it doesn’t look out of place on the wheel. Looks right. 

My only complaint is that the washers/spacers didn’t quite fit. I used the 2 new ones given, plus 1 old one. It still had a little play (2mm). Each washer is 3.5mm thick. But, once I tightened everything down, it seemed okay.
list.author: Joseph Deguzman

list.content: The items themselves, the pedals, are well made and the same as from the manufacturer. The extra parts were all in the box. However, the extra "spacers" were poorly 3d printed, hard to use, and there were no instructions ( the spacers didn't fit in any obvious way ). I hope I've assembled it correctly.
list.author: Brian Bulkowski

list.content: I put these larger pedals on my Glide 3/V8 and I love them. The rubber is grippy and the bigger size gives me much more comfort and control.
list.author: Joe Lanzi

list.content:
Excellent service. 
Ordered from UK arrived within 3 days!
Quality. 
Pedals upgraded on V8, much better, more room now!
list.author: Matt Milburn

list.content: Excellent pedals and if you own an Inmotion V8/Glide 3 you should definitely upgrade. You can ride for hours without foot fatigue. Only problem I had with the pedals were when folded up it didn't stay however I learned that it was my installation fault. I didn't tighten the two side pedal screws in hard in enough. After tightening the side screws the pedals stay as designed. Thank you eWheels!
list.author: Anonymous

name: NEW: Inmotion XL Pedals for V10/F, V8/Glide 3, V5F/Glide 2
relatedProductsNames: 12” x 9” Piece of Jessup Skate Grip Tape

shortDescription: Back in stock, shipping now
Compatible with the KS14S/D, KS16S, KS18S, KS18L, & KS18XL (the XL will be installed with the new pedals at the factory)
This listing is for a set of pedals
Existing eWheel Customers will be credited back the shipping costs within the continental USA

list.content: I put these on my kingsong 14 D,  not only are they more comfortable but they give me more control.
list.author: John Arnold

list.content: Installation is much easier using the rod to hammer in/out the other rod instead of using a screwdriver like suggested in the youtube videos. I found out myself on my second pedal.
list.author: Vincent Liu

list.content: The new longer & black pedals look great on my 18S. They arrived quickly and were easy to install. Happy all around!
list.author: William Trefrey

list.content: I wear a size 10.5 men shoe and these 10" pedals make a huge difference for the KS16S. More control and no slippage.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: I am so glad I upgraded my stock KS18L pedals to the bigger pedals. The installation was a breeze. The ride quality is amazing and the extra grip and  surface area keeps me more stable on rough rides.
list.author: Adam Moises Jr

list.content:
Much better than the originals.

I attached brushes like Solowheel's failed kickstarter, by drilling directly through my pedals.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content:
I bought my ks16s at a different online retailer. I still suck at riding and I've been practicing for six months. One of my issues is that my feet get really fatigued and cramp. I just took my new pedals out for a short ride and I like them a lot. 

I drilled holes into my old pedals and these new pedals and screwed industrial brushes to the bottom of my pedals to help me stay balance left-to-right. My feet and calves didn't tire out like they usually do. These were worth the money because I will start using my wheel more now.
list.author: Tony Mc

list.content:
Improved my KS14D tremendously
Extended riding time
Reduced tired feet and ankle cramp and pains
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: Great pedals.  Comfortable to use.  Love the black color.  Well worth the upgrade.  Pretty simple to install and get going!
list.author: Jeremey Leib

list.content: These new King Song extended length pedals are a huge improvement from the original pedals that the King Song 16S originally came with.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: These pedals are a must for all King Song EUCs. The griptape is more coarse. There is full grip coverage from edge to edge. The size allows for more surface area to grip. Much greater confidence when riding on uneven surfaces. Black looks much better on any color wheel.
list.author: Michael Hernandez

list.content: The pedals have improved my riding skill and enjoyment of my KS18L tremendously. I could never go back to a smaller pedal. I won't buy any wheel that doesn't have an equal or larger pedal.
list.author: Jerome Byrd

list.content: Really makes riding safer and more comfortable.
list.author: Gregory Pope

list.content: I recently purchased the new pedals for my KS-16S. I'm extremely satisfied. The new pedals are much more comfortable and and the grip is much improved.  The replacement process is a bit difficult though since the peg that holds the pedal can be difficult to get out.
list.author: Timothy Petty

list.content: I added to my KS16S and it’s made a huge difference.  Footing feels more stable and easier to maneuver with less fatigue.  Should be the factory standard moving forward.
list.author: Brian Crowell

list.content: Had to drill and tap Xl pedal hinge for Allen screw and pin to fit KS-16s,There great worth the effort.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: I installed the XL pedals on KingSong 16s, I've noticed more control especially when riding extremely slow. When installing the new XL pedals you will only use 1 set screw per pedal. I would highly recommend these pedals!! Thanks to ewheels (Jason) !!
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: Never knew that a pedal would make such a big difference in the ride.  I didn't know what I was missing until I got these pedals.  They are much better than the prototype and I absolutely love them.  Highly recommended upgrade to the 18" wheels.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content:
Fact: King Song never intended to make these new 10" pedals, stubbornly sticking to their childrens' sized stock pedals.

Fact: All other competitors have launched bigger pedal sizes.

Fact: These 10" KS pedals would not exist today without the patience and persisting of one Jason McNeill of eWheels.com.

Plain and simple, there is no other North American EUC distributor pushing for the overall better-ment of today's EUC market / culture, let alone adding value for eWheels.com customers.

Quite honestly, King Song HQ should be offering these stock with their new wheels, but their stubborn lack of understanding with rider comfort and average Western feet / shoe sizing has left eWheels footing most of the investment.

If you have a current gen KS wheel, don't just buy these pedals for the increased comfort + quality (which they are IMHO), but buy them also to send a message to King Song to take their heads out of their a**es and listen to the Western World KS customers that actually ride their product day-in and day-out.
list.author: Christopher Yim

list.content: Great addition to my KS-16s
list.author: Nick Leonard

list.content: Classic example of how Jason and EWheels went out of their way to help guide the EUC industry by working with KingSong to jointly develop this larger pedal and wow what a difference. Easy to fit on my 16s it is significantly more comfortable than my previous pedals and seems to make the ride more stable and easier to manoevre. An investment recommended for all KingSong owners in my eyes.
list.author: Chris L

list.content: I upgraded KingSong 18L pedals to a 10"/25cm extended length pedals.  The benefit I've noticed right away is the foot position as soon as you hop on.  Your 'WHOLE' foot lands on the pedal every time and not half way off infront of the pedal like the original pedals.  If you are a beginner, upgrade your pedals immediately!!!  Another big plus is you can now be able to change your position of your foot while in motion where as before, I couldn't with the shorter pedals.  What I mean is you can wiggle your foot in any position since you now have more space to move.
list.author: JOHN DUMAINE

list.content: Just received and installed 3 sets of this pedals to my KS 14c, 16s and 18AY, it is so big and comfortable.  It is a MUST to any Kingsong wheels.
list.author: Peter Quan

name: New: King Song 10″/25cm Extended Length Pedal
relatedProductsNames: NEW: Inmotion XL Pedals for V10/F, V8/Glide 3, V5F/Glide 2

shortDescription: Both Black & White back in stock & shipping now!
NEW: available in a cheaper 340Wh capacity for just $750
BONUS: equipped with the XL pedals & free wrist-guards, a $115 upgrade value
14D is in a class of it’s own, leaves similar entry/mid-range 14″ quite far behind in performance capability
Perfect choice for someone starting out, or looking to upgrade from an Airwheel, Segway S1, or even an Inmotion V5F

list.content: This was my fist wheel. Within a few hours I was able to hop on and ride it in a open area. By the 2nd day I could control my direction and easily ride on sidewalks. Ive been riding it 5-10 miles per day on average with no problems. So much fun. If anything, I wish it could go a little faster but its half the price of faster wheels so Ill let it slide.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: My use is recreational. It took a few minutes to learn to ride, a few hours of riding to control turns safely, very well built wheel and extremely fun!
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: Super fun first wheel! I've had the 14D for 2 weeks and ridden a little over 200 miles already. Make sure to get a full face moto helmet because you will crash learning to ride. Such a fun mode of transportation, I make up excuses to run to the store now. Great acceleration, super tight turning and just a blast to ride!
list.author: DAVID CHARTER

list.content: Very reliable, well built EUC. Good for a starter EUC, or a lightweight short range commuter. I use this EUC to teach my friends on, and to run quick errands. Great value for the money.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: I am still on the very beginning of the learning curve, so I cannot provide a deep technical review, but it seems to work excellent. I have one complaint though: the paddings for calfs at the top of the wheel could be bigger and softer.  Padding for ankles does not exist. It hurts quite a bit and I got bruises on my calfs. I had to come with my own home solution for these paddings.  And I am reading that it is not only me, complaining. Even expert riders add their own padding for comfort and stability.  This is the reason why I give the wheel 4 stars.
list.author: Alexander Kamensky

list.content: So far, it’s awesome. Just started today. Looks and feels of nice quality / and durable. Everything works.
list.author: Jacob Ferguson

list.content: I really don’t have anything to compare this to as it is my first EUC. Thought myself to ride in about 10 sessions with the help of a few YouTube videos. Still not 100% confident but am at about 90%. The wheel seems great and resilient - for sure it has take a bit of a beating. So far, so good.
list.author: Douglas Smith

list.content: This is my first euc! Loving it, came from Meepo V3 ER. KS14D seems to be getting about the same range as my e-board; 20 miles, although at almost half the speed. The tilt sensor isn't timid about tilting you backwards once you pass 18mph. It only took me about an hour to learn basics how to ride with youtube videos, now 2 days later i feel alot more confident in my ability, can almost drain the battery in one ride, ride through grass and dirt, up and down small curbs. What's stopping me is soreness from the muscles I've been building while riding. It's takes alot of balance and most of your weight ends of leaning on your shins pressed against the wheel. Im still getting used to that with bruised shins, i should take a day or 2 break and let them heal but it's soo much fun I can't stop haha my only complaint is the King Song App. EWheels sent me an email about a different app that actually worked better. But it still lacked key info from real app. So sometimes i need to switch between apps, can be a pain. App is required to unlock the wheel when it first arrives, but after that you never need to use the app again.
list.author: Jeremiah Wesche

list.content: This is a very play full and durable wheel you will get your money worth. I own many wheels and all the wheels that I like is wheels that put on a light show and have Bluetooth speakers and must have performance with no headaches. The kingsong 14D IS THE WHEEL YOU TAKE TO GO HERE AND THERE AND DO Freestyle tricks. This wheel will not disappoint you. I would have  chosen the v8 since I own a V10f but the V8 or the v5 didn’t have Bluetooth speakers and Ditton come in white. Plus the price 14D YOUGET MORE FOR YOUR BUCK. IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR YOUR FIRST WHEEL OR HAVE 18 OR16 Inch wheel AND YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A WHEEL TO JUST TOHAVE FUN WITH AND CAN TAKE IT ANYWHERE This wheel is what your looking for. Thanks E wheels fast Delivery and service will be buying from you again
list.author: Robert recco

list.content: Very impressed with the fit and finish of this product.  Furthermore the build quality is excellent.  My Daughter and I beat this wheel up as we were learning and despite a few scrapes on the body and pedals it has been a tank.  There is no loose pieces or degraded functionality.  Wheel is for my daughter and she now loves it.  I highly recommend KingSong and eWheels.
list.author: Jeffrey Felton

list.content: So much fun! Definitely a huge learning curve at the beginning but so much worth it. Would buy again and recommended my friends to buy it.
list.author: Gloria Gerngross

list.content:
My experience with ewheels is at the end....
I'm a 43 year old male, 6'-3"& 235lbs.
I'm highly impressed with KingSong 14D! I'm 35lbs over recommended weight and it did not hinder the functioning of this lil machine at all, the extra weight does drain the battery quicker. Sorry I can't say what I got in range on single charge because I upgraded quickly because I knew I was sticking with riding EUC so I needed range. I have crashed it several times and besides some scratches it continues to work totally fine. The trolley handle works really well, it will work better for someone shorter but I have long arms so it worked for me, BTW, KingSong has best trolley handle designs. I got the 14D up to 18 mph with no problem, keep in mind I'm over the weight limit, so again impressive! 
  I can tell that KingSong really puts time/effort into it making a product that will make the whole experience of owning and riding a EUC safe, functional and enjoyable! 
I wish I had more input to give regarding extended durability if this KingSong 14D but I only put lil over hundred miles on it before I was upgrading. But again this lil wheel impressed me, it has taken me up steep inclines, light off roading and it's handle it like A TANK! 
If money is tight and you're not sure this type of experience will be something you will stick with, get this because you still be be getting a quality machine, that won't break the bank. The speakers are fair, I liked the lights more than I thought I would but with that said, personally I can do without lights and speakers.
   I know myself will enough to know that just by watching YouTube videos that I was going to love having a EUC so I wish I had skipped this wheel and purchased a wheel that I had plenty of room to grow into. I have a Gotway MSP now and I wish it had been my first wheel. Because of health issues the EUC replaced my bicycle, so it's given me back my freedom to get back outside, have fun and see the world, one trail at a time! Riding a EUC is such a freeing sensation!! I have to admit though, I honestly viewed EUC's as toys before I rode one but I quickly realized these EUCs are built tough, so now I consider them as legit personal transportation vehicles.

My experience with Ewheels: I'm old school in the since that I value professionalism, I believe in doing what you say and if you mess up, admit it and do all you can to make things right, these are values that are almost extinct now days!!! Except for this company, I'm TOTALLY pleased with my dealings with them! Ewheels values their customers and they strive to make their customers completely satisfied!!!! I've purchased 4 wheels from them and you should buy your wheel from them also!
list.author: Marius

list.content: I love how quiet it is and the acceleration and stopping are great. Took me about 2 hours of learning around my house grabbing on the counters here and there to keep my balance. Then once I got outside it was exhilarating to cruise around the neighborhood. Buyer beware, none of the YouTube videos I saw tell you that your legs, and feet are going to be wicked sore. Setting up the DarknessBot app was done completely blind.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: looks great.  decent learning curve for a 54 year-old.  Documentation is a bit spare but the quality appears to be excellent.
list.author: Ann McKnight

list.content: This is my first wheel and I am glad I bought this one because within in 30 minutes I was off.  I read the reviews on how much easier it is to learn on and I am very happy.  I will upgrade to a larger model for longer distances.  I only get about 13 miles on this one.  Its my only regret as the other larger was not in stock.
list.author: Tony Lucero

list.content:
This is my first EUC I've purchased, and I'm very happy with it.  Jason helped me decide which wheel would be a good choice for a beginner.  I taught myself how to ride, as I am the first in my area to ride an EUC.  It took me several weeks, but I eventually figured it out.  Now don't drive my car all weekend long, I just take my wheel all over town.  A quick trip downtown is a breeze, even during heavy summer traffic.  It has more power than I expected, and has no trouble taking me(170 lbs.) up steep hills.
It is also very maneuverable.  I have no trouble avoiding defects on the road or on trails in the woods.
list.author: daniel hubbard

list.content:
I had originally purchased the iPS A130.  Although really cute, I cannot recommend the A130, especially not as a starter wheel.  The pedal platform would not stay flat.  It kept tilting back for no apparent reason and therefore was very hard to ride.

The King Song 14D is a fine wheel.  It's a little more nimble than my InMotion V8, because the 14D has a smaller wheel, but I think that nimbleness which might make it better on busy sidewalks, makes it a bit harder to learn to ride than the V8.

The King Song Motor cutoff switch (stops wheel from spinning when you pick it up) senses that you're lifting the weight of the wheel from the handle (which is also the trolley handle.)  It's automatic.  This model also has headlights on both ends and Bluetooth speakers and a USB port for charging your phone etc. - Nice extras.
list.author: Erich Paetow

list.content: Kingsong has made an awesome gadget at a reasonable price point and I'm very happy with my decision to purchase the Kingsong 14D. This thing has plenty of speed and I don't see myself wanting to do over 20 mph anytime soon. It's easy to maneuver, provides a good body-toning workout when carrying the close to 30 pounds of tech.  I would definitely recommend this model to others and look forward to moving up to the 16X someday.
list.author: Rember Burthey

list.content: This wheel is comparable to my InMotion V8 but it's got a smaller wheel 14" vs 16" which mite make it a bit more nimble, but not as good for off pavement.  I love the bigger pedals and that the headlight comes on in the dark (there's a light sensor) whether you are riding it forwards or backwards (it has head and tail lights at each end.)  I also love the integrated handle which is also the trolley handle and that it senses when it's being lifted and turns off the wheel so it doesn't overspeed. - Erich
list.author: Erich Paetow

list.content: I'm really impressed with this wheel.  I thought it would be much harder to learn but was pleasantly surprised at how quickly I got the hang of it.  Very well made and simply a blast to ride.  If your thinking about this King Son - buy it.  You'll be glad you did. Great value and amazing fun factor! I'm married but If you're single - this thing attracts girls better than puppies or babies!
list.author: Matthew Pompey

list.content: My wife just got this electric unicycle.  It is the perfect size for her, she's still getting with familiar with riding it, but she is having great fun.  A good excuse to get out of the house together and enjoy the outdoors.  As far as performance, the King Song 14D is very nimble, easy to maneuver, light weight and packed with features.  A great first wheel for anyone looking to get into the electric unicycle niche.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: Wonderful little thing. Im at the 1 week mark in practice (about an hour a day) and Im finally able to ride on sidewalks! Controls very well and works nicely as a learning wheel.  Look forward to using its full potential soon!!
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: My first wheel, so far it's a lot of fun. I'm already thinking of a faster second wheel.
list.author: Joseph Nolte

list.content:
I'm a new rider and this is my first wheel, so I can't really speak to the quality or performance versus other wheels.

I will say that while I regretted not going for a "forever wheel" at first, I think the 14D was the right call in hindsight. 30lbs doesn't sound like a lot, but it's more than you might think when you're extending a one-arm carry away from your core to put it in a truck bed or something.

It's light enough that I'm not afraid when it spins around a bit after bailing as well.

I wasn't sure if it had a lift-sensor, but it apparently does, and it works very well. As far as I can tell, it's just a baby version of the 18XL or 16S.

And it can really take a beating! I must've dumped it 30 times so far, and other than some scratches on the glossy finish, no harm done that I can tell.

The only negative I can come up with is the pads. Really hard on the inside of my calves. I think that's an issue of technique and muscle buildup I'll overcome in a couple weeks. But that's why I deducted 1 point. I think a pad (even some sort of extension like a seat?) that hit closer to the knees instead of mid-shin would solve that.

Because of the size and performance limits, I think it'll be a great wheel for my son when I do eventually move on to something bigger/faster/longer-range.

Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the wheel to anyone new to EUCs would wanted something fun to try out. And if you don't plan to commute with it, or are in a lower-speed dense urban area with bike lanes for the most part, I think you could probably live with it happily as your only wheel for a very long time.
list.author: Sam Smoot

list.content: The KS14D rides great. Has nice accel and decel. I like having the speakers, but at cruising speed not easy to hear. Trolley handle is really smooth and like the single handle. It has a very noisy whine compared to my Solowheel. “Please decelerate” command is obnoxious—not sure if it can be turned off.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: It only took about 10 to 15 minutes before I could ride it. It is a pretty amazing device. I'm 200lbs which is at the limit but it does just fine and climbs pretty good too
list.author: Joe Kirby

list.content:
This is the perfect wheel for me as I generally use it for shorter distances and I don't need it to go any faster than it does.  What actually impresses me more is how slow it can go while navigating through people/bikes.  I've never used another wheel so I don't have anything to compare it to but it's remarkably smooth, well-designed, and withstood the beating I put it through while I was learning.

A few tips...

I wish I had used a strap on the handle to avoid the superficial damage it took while learning so learn from my mistakes and use one. 

If you'll be carrying the wheel up or down stairs, don't cheat and carry it with the handle extended, it's not meant to take on the weight of the wheel at that position.  My handle started jamming while putting in the down position because of that.  

Make sure the tires are always fully inflated.  I had a couple flat tires due to slightly deflated tires getting pinched and it's a project to replace the inner-tube.  

My first wheel was either outright stolen or the person who came upon it when I accidentally left it unattended for longer than I should have didn't know who to call so I recommend sticking a label with your contact info on it.  

Happy wheeling!
list.author: Walter Koehler

list.content: I love my king song 14d is work for the purpose that I bought it like from the house to the car short distance ride the only thing I don't like is the same pads b r a little on the hard side apart from that work perfect
list.author: Limayah John

list.content: excellent product
list.author: CARLOS SALINAS

list.content: Best mid class so far (at least for me lol) speed and power is where the KS14D shines , from quick acceleration to smooth stops , the KS14D never disappoints, I commute to NYC every day and regret not having purchased this wheel sooner ( 4 miles daily ) the wheel now feels in sync with my thoughts and carves thru the  corners like a rocket, you will NOT GET BORED of this wheel  any time soon thanks to its power and battery life , also the case feels like it can take the abuse and the lights are really helpful specially now that the winter is coming, the only issue I had is with the handle rails bottoms , right at the end , the end piece came loose and snapped, thanks to the great customer support from EWHEELS , that was taken care of by Jason , thanks guys for providing excellent customer service.
list.author: William A.

list.content: This is my first e-unicycle. I started off with the onewheel v1 but range was always on the back of my mind. I love this wheel. Not only is it really fun to ride, I use it to commute to work, a 10 mile trip each way, when it is nice outside. My only regret is not getting the ks14s or the ks16s instead for the longer range.
list.author: Kevin

list.content:
First wheel purchase
Reason for purchase - Commute to work, I live in San Francisco and the hills are just as annoying going up and down

Why did I choose a eWheel - I considered all sorts of electric vehicles, these eWheels are the most versatile, you can go on the street or on the sidewalk, they are also very small so it's easy to maneuver around people or bring into a restaurant and put under your chair.

How long did it take to learn to ride - about an hour trying to balance in my house, 1 or two more hours outside practicing before I felt comfortable riding to work.

Durability -  During the practice phase I lost control a couple times going decently fast and jumped off the wheel took a nice tumble but it's shown zero signs of slowing down

Speed - I was considering a slightly slower wheel and I'm happy I chose this one, once you get used to it the speed is nice, especially if you need to tackle hills

Favorite feature - Effortlessly going up hills, I have friends who have electric skateboards and their boards aren't able to get them up the same hills I cruise over. The lights on the front and back are nice safety features for night time

Quirks - The apps are really janky and you need to download them to unlock the speed

Suggestions to manufacturer for improvement - the telescoping handle could go a little higher, I'm not that tall so it's manageable but if I were any taller i would have to be very hunched over to use it. 
The speed is controlled electronically and if you are exceeding the max speed it will beep and pull you back a little bit, this is fine on flat ground but when the battery is running low and you are going up hill it thinks you are going max speed when you are not going very fast. I think the speed is measured by measuring some variable of energy usage rather than calculating rotational speed

Overall I love this device, all my friends thought I was a weirdo for buying one, but they are slowly coming around to understanding this is the future of transportation!
list.author: Jono

list.content:
A few months ago when I got really excited about getting an EUC, I spent several weeks researching the options and decided this was the one for me. My wife wasn't convinced (she thought it was a pricey toy I'd lose interest in after a day). So I waited, not at all patiently, and by that time it was Christmas and since I'd spent the intervening time making her watch videos and reviews she surprised me with one!
It arrived and she still was not impressed. I took it out and went through the necessary 15-30 minutes of just trying to roll the the thing a few feet before it clicked. For about a month she showed no interest in it until she happened to see me gliding (i ride it to work everyday) and she agreed to give it a try. She can be a bit uncoordinated, so she hasn't taken to it as quickly as I have, but she's stubborn. The point is, anyone can learn to ride this thing and just standing on it is enough to make you a believer. She told me to get her one for her birthday. Can't wait for our first riding date.
Some things you should know:
It's awesome and I love it. I can attest to what has been said about slower models, I wanted to max this thing out as soon as it would let me (5km traveled). I have very little desire to go faster, especially after my crash at top speed, more on that later.
It is sturdy. I fell off the front at 18 mph, skidded several feet across the road, and thanks to my liberal application of padding, there was barely a scratch on the unicycle. Me not so much, but I was lucky. Wear pads.
It's going to take a few days to get proficient. After the first training session, I was very sore. Muscles I don't use very much got a real work out and until you can balance and shift your weight proficiently you're going to bang up your legs.
Heed the tilt back warning. The only crash I've had was a bad one and it was all because I was stupid. Once I hit the top speed I tried leaning even harder into it to see how fast I could go. Once you reach top speed, that is it. If you lean more, it's not going to speed up, which means no more torque, which means there's nothing to keep you upright. Painful lesson but I did it for you guys and gals. The good news is that it took concerted effort and stupidity to lean over the tilt back so you can't do it accidentally.
When joy riding I very rarely reach half battery capacity, the point where you begin to slow down. I'm usually a bit tired and cold by then and happy to wind down, but if 30-45 minutes isn't a long enough ride for you, consider the 14S.
list.author: Jordan

list.content: I have only been learning on the wheel so far. Out of the box the wheels seems very well built. I have no experience on other wheels but I am learning pretty quickly and can ride without needing to balance against a wall after about 3 hours of practice. I am enjoying it. The wheel's extra features like headlight, LED lights, charging port are great additions. The telescoping handle has been very useful as well. Very happy with it so far.
list.author: Jake

list.content: Great EUC and very good dealer! I learned fast in a week and now my kids are starting to learn! I definitely agree that this is the best for  newbies like me and my kids! I might buy a new Kingsong in the future because of the safety designed they make for the riders!!! Thanks ewheels!!!
list.author: Erick

list.content: Awesome wheel. Good speed and good distance. Lights and music are really nice.  I could not be happier!
list.author: Kenneth

list.content: The KS14D rides very well, is quick and responsive and has great battery life and range.  I originally bought this for my 13 year old daughter to ride around the neighborhood, but I test drove it and took it around town and was VERY impressed with how well it performed.  I weigh 190 lbs and I found it was responsive, smooth and nimble.  My daughter weighs 90 lbs and the wheel performs flawlessly for her, with great range and handling.  She can pick it up easily on her own (it weighs 27.5 lbs) and it's much more compact than I thought it would be.  This is a great wheel for a first time rider (child or adult).  I'll be ordering a Kingsong 16S for myself so my daughter and I can go on rides together.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: First off let me say I’m 63 years old and have been looking at these wheels for over a year on YouTube. I heard Jason’s name mentioned on a video and decided to give him a call. I was looking at a cheaper wheel to learn on and he recommended the KingSong 14D, I hesitated because it was a couple hundred dollars more, but decided to take his advice and I’m glad I did! This thing is top quality and the travel handle is perfect. The nice thing about it is I won’t grow out of it in a few weeks. I’m already riding all over my neighborhood and if I want to get more speed, I can unlock the speed limiter! Trust me, if your like me and just starting out the KingSong 14D is the one! Thank you eWheels
list.author: John Arnold

list.content:
This wheel is my absolute favorite.
I’ve had four different wheels and the 18XL is by far the best to me.
Fast
Stable
Smooth
Long range 
Very comfortable 

What more could you ask for:
list.author: Justin Hicks

list.content: Absolutely awesome wheel!
list.author: jesse miller

list.content:
This is my first wheel. I debated a lot between the 16x, Nikola, and this wheel.
I decided on this one because of the durability and reliability. Great range, and all the bells and whistles.
Learning to ride on the heavier wheel has been tough, but it's an amazing ride. So smooth and lots of power!
I'm looking forward to putting thousands of miles on this fantastic wheel.
Thanks ewheels!
list.author: Scott Thompson

list.content: Such a great wheel. Rides so smoothly and is so comfortable turns have this sway that I'm looking for in a 18" wheel. The 16x is more responsive but that's exactly why I love the 18XL: it's the most pleasant thing to ride. It's that perfect balance between soft and hard. Just right so you can enjoy carving at reasonable speeds. Plus it looks "friendly", futuristic, has a fantastic trolley, amazing range, powerful, parts are relatively cheap and available, tube easy to replace and inflate, has good speakers... What more do you want? Perfect commuting wheel! A head-turner for sure! Add to this the fantastic service by ewheels and you're golden :) I've tried (and owned several) all the best wheels and this is my favourite for everyday use
list.author: Frederic Antoun

list.content: Very good wheel to transition to from smaller wheels. Made with quality material and long range. Pedals are large so less foot fatigue. Over all a solid choice in a Midrange wheel.
list.author: Francisco Esperon

list.content: This is my first EUC and it is fantastic. It was easier to learn than I expected and rides very smoothly.
list.author: Michael DeCandia

list.content: This is my most comfortable EUC I own I have the kingsong 14D I use in skate parks and to go to places where on a plnch and trying new tricks knowing it can take a beating the 18XL is the 14D on steroids very well made music and lights are the best out there plus king song gives you a color Choice and I like white it stands out from the rest that are all black and Jason is the only guy that you can get white from and the Service and delivery are out of this world. Will be buying Another the EUC FROM JASON THIS GUY KNOWS HOW TO RUN A Business that take care of is customers not like some out there.
list.author: Robert Recco

list.content: I don't have a lot experience with EUCs but this device is solidly built, durable, and has been a lot of fun so far.
list.author: Eddie Liu

list.content: So far I have no complaints. I have only been able to put àbout 15 miles on it so I can't give an actual review yet. Will update at around 50 mile mark
list.author: David Noel

list.content: This was my first device recommended by eWheels and I have to say Im glad I made this choice. Its fun to ride and feels stable. Great wheel and great service.
list.author: Gibran Johnson

list.content:
Outstanding product. Quality is evident right out of the box. Excellent fit and finish, beautiful design. It was a difficult choice between KingSong and competitors (Gotway, specifically), but I ultimately chose KingSong based on their strong reputation for safety and reliability. 

This was my first EUC; I’d never set foot on one prior to pulling this out of the box. It is relatively large as EUC’s go and fairly heavy as well at a bit over 50 lbs, so it took some time to learn how to control it.  I watched several tutorial videos on YouTube and after about 2 hours of trial and error, something suddenly “clicked” in my brain and I was able to ride figure eights with little effort! Over the next two days I logged 25 miles over a combination of gravel, paved roads and even some grass, and the 18XL handled all with ease. An incredibly rewarding and thrilling experience. I read several reviews that suggested beginners should start with something smaller and easier to control, but don’t let that influence you. I’m proof that a newbie can learn to ride on these advanced wheels. 

I’d also highly recommend purchasing the protective neoprene cover, especially if you’re new to EUC’s. I also purchased and highly recommend the eWheels rapid charger; an incredibly nice upgrade over the stock charger.
list.author: Gary Osterberg

list.content: Just like most people on the forum agree, the King Song 18XL is a high quality, refined wheel that is smooth, quiet, powerful, agile and stable. It does many things so well. Compared to the other wheels, this one seems to have nothing that bothers me. In the EUC world, this one seems to quietly and reliably go about its business seemingly unnoticed, when it is one of the best. It may be because it has the 2.5 inch tire when the popular size now is 3 inches. I'm a big guy and find the tire size more than adequate for most situations. If I could only have one wheel, this would be the one!
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: This thing is a unit! My first wheel was an InMotion V8 that I rode for a year before deciding to upgrade to the King Song 18XL. The increased speed, range, and power have all made for an amazing riding experience. The KS 18XL takes a bit more effort to turn than the smaller V8, but it is still very agile despite being a much larger wheel. However, you will feel the extra weight when lifting it off the ground. If you're a smaller rider or looking for a last mile commuting solution, then you should probably check out some slimmer and lighter EUCs that will be easier to lift and transport. This wheel was designed with long range cruising in mind. I went with the KS 18XL over flagship models from other manufacturers due to it having the best combination of power and practicality. This thing can go anywhere, whether you're riding or walking. I have yet to find a hill it can't climb and King Song's best in class trolley handle allows you to walk around with minimal effort when you'd rather be on your feet. When you also factor in unique features like the large peddles, lift sensor, mudflap, brake light, quiet motor, and more speed than you'll probably ever need, you've got one of the best wheels in the game.
list.author: Brian Ross

list.content: Wheel arrived in perfect condition and fast. The wheel came with firmware 2.0 and the upgraded motor. It is considerably wide compared to the Inmotion V10. It is very comfortable riding at an average speed of 15 mph. So far, a full charge at 84.4V has lasted 40 miles with 75V remaining at an average speed of 12 mph. The wheel is quite heavy. The lift sensor is responsive and turns off the motor quick. This is a good forever wheel for the moment if speed isn't a factor.
list.author: Anonymous

list.content: My husband got a hang of this in one day. he loves it!! he thinks it's bad ass!!
list.author: Anonymous

list.content:
100 miles in the first 3 days - after getting into this about two weeks ago?  Three of the best days of my life!  I was lucky enough to get a really good deal on a ninebot one e+ a couple weeks ago.  Took 10 hours across three days to find my balance, but then I started to explore.  Just an exhilarating experience once I got going - and understanding how much there is to learn and grow with this experience.  And it's contemporary.  And it's cool.

I settled on the Kingsong 18XL as the best all around wheel for someone like myself, looking for the ultimate upgrade from the e+.  It is exactly what I wanted - torque, range, speed.  I've still only hit 26 MPH, and that felt super fast.  I'm guessing as I gain experience, I will also gain comfort.

I've really put the unit through it's paces in the last few days - one super nice day, once out in the rain, and today out in the puddles and mud.  Really hoping it can take this abuse over the long haul - be interesting to find out.

I'd say in my novice ability that this wheel really likes smooth surfaces - it just glides, and takes corners really well - also learning to carve long S turns, which this unit (all wheels?) really seems made for.  It's torque is super impressive going up hills, I've never felt like it didn't have enough power, just my lack of ability, or loose ground has stopped some ascents.  It manages offroad really well, but I think I might have the tire pressure a bit high (right around 40) which bounced me around on the more uneven surfaces.  Sure that offroad is a lot of technique/experience too.  Really like the foot pedals - big and grippy.  My feet were getting ruined by the ninebot e+, and in the last three days of riding, my feet have actually improved on the 18XL, so that is a good sign.

So I'm all in on this unit, and can't wait to keep improving my skill - always remember - Safety First!
list.author: Ben Hatfield

list.content: First wheel for me so no reference but so far it's performed as advertised.
list.author: stuart collier

list.content:
This is my first EUC. 18xl pulls my 215lb body around with ease. Very smooth, I also have a OW Xr and this 18xl has much more power and Has a very nice ride. 
small imperfections in the road that would disrupt the OW the 18xl glides right over them.
list.author: Stewart Ciesla

list.content: The 18L is a great wheel. I own an Inmotion V8 (very good wheel) that I got from Ewheels about a year ago and decided to upgrade to a larger wheel with higher top speed. Right off the bat the 18 handles very well even with the larger wheel. This wheel just cruises along at 20 to 25mph very comfortable, it can go faster but I have not pushed it yet. I recommend this wheel to anybody upgrading from a smaller wheel or just getting into EUC's. Jason is very helpful and quick to reply to questions or issues if they come up. Very happy with both of these wheels. Cheers!
list.author: Kyle

list.content:
Great all around wheel!
Suited mostly to bike trails but can handle offroad as well. Super convenient trolley handle & nice lighting on the sides! Definitely get the fast charger, totally worth it. I love the cover too!!
list.author: Floyd Bunch

list.content: This is my first EUC. I purchased the King Song 18XL based on You Tube videos and recommendations from the EUC Forum. I'm 6'0 210 lbs . I have had my first ride yesterday doing around 20km in distance. The 18XL feels very well balanced and feels very stable. Its quite heavy but after a couple training sessions it felt "normal". It came with a roll.nz cover which looks and fits great! Very pleased with my purchase and dealing with eWheels was a very positive experience !
list.author: Dave Lovett

list.content: I absolutely fell in love with this machine. I spent like 9 hours learning in the course of two days. I am a complete newb. I am now riding around the neighborhood. Dont give up! I can see how this is not just a transportation device but a connection. I love this machine!
list.author: Michael Vivirito

list.content: Best money I ever spent.  Sturdy, fast, practical, and fun.
list.author: Seth Kursel

list.content:
I purchased this a few months back and purposely waited 250km to write a review.  My first wheel was an Mten3.  At 190lbs, I destroyed that first wheel in 11 months, but saw the benefits of having ultra portable transportation.  In Michigan, our roads are bumpy where they get patched - almost like cobblestones in spots.  For that reason, I wanted a large wheel that would takes those bumps without throwing the rider off.  I use the wheel for last 10 miles transportation and some longer hauls that are more recreational and some shorter trips that are 2 to 4 miles.  It came down to the MSX and the 18XL as the finalists.  Having been on the Mten3, I wanted something that had a bigger footprint, but could still be lifted up (53lbs) by a reasonable strength male.  The primary differentiators that made me select the XL are the trolley handle, foot petals, narrower width, removable side panels, bluetooth, reportedly lower cost of replacement parts.

That trolley handle is amazing - I ran out of battery about 4 miles from my destination this week and walked the machine the rest of the way without issue.  The XL trolley handle actually has two heights - halfway up it can lock at about 3' off the ground or can go up another foot to about 4'.

Next - the foot petals are rounded.  That makes the nearly impossible to ground out even on tight turns.  They are incredibly grippy and comfortable even on a multi-hour ride.

The narrower width was actually something I thought was going to be a regretable decision.  The MSX has that wide tire that looked more attractive and robust.  The XL's tire is a beast though.  2.5" wide.  The machine feels super comfortable while riding.

With the XL, I got the body-glove rubberized cover.  If you purchase and XL, get this.  it saved me when I fumbled a bit in the beginning at stoplights and ended up laying the machine on its side as I lost balance.  Looks very good and the side mood lighting comes through the pre-cut holes.

The bluetooth was a selling feature.  I use it for Google maps and it takes me right from point A to B.  The sound is plenty good and very loud if the rider wants it to be.

Finally, I am embarrassingly incompetent with mechanical repairs.  Like I will never be able to change the tire bad.  For that reason, I wanted a machine that was friendly for Ewheels to provide service on.  The XL seems to come apart and go back together relatively easily for a mechanic who does this every day.  We will find out in time if I was correct.

The negatives are nitpicky
1) the Kingsong application is buggy and continually crashes, but is still more feature-rich than what I had with the Gotway before I killed that EUC last August.

2) the speed throttling I was not looking forward to.  It kept me to 40km/hr for the first 200km of distance.  Unlike my dead Mten3, the XL doesn't beep - it says "PLEASE DECELERATE" so loud that it is embarrassing.  That turned out to be a good thing though and kept me to modest speeds until I learned the wheel.  I guarantee you that 31MPH top end speed is plenty sufficient for almost every rider.  I rarely hit that top number even on open smooth roads.

3) braking is "meh" - the 18" wheels are cruisers.  The XL is plenty fast off the line and has more than enough beef to get up a steep gradient.  In the few instances where I had to come to a quick stop, the heavy back lean caused the wheel to wobble as I slowed quickly.  This is more a function of having an 18" wheel vs a performance defect.
